scene_metadata.title: Love Through the Armor Holes
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: the paradox of protection preventing cure

dialogue.action: draws a knight and a poet
dialogue.text: It thinks its job is to defend. But healing happens when defenses lower. Love comes in through the holes in the armor, not because you welded it shut.

panel_1.description: Architect's hand sketching an armored knight

panel_2.description: Adding a poet figure beside the knight

panel_3.description: Light/love flowing through gaps in armor

visual_elements.environment: studio as teaching space through art

psychological_notes: The knight/poet duality represents the eternal conflict between protection and openness. The image of love entering through armor holes reframes vulnerability not as weakness but as necessary opening for healing.
philosophical_underpinning: We must risk wounding to allow healing; the cure enters through the same door as the hurt
therapeutic_direction: Helping clients see their defenses as barriers to the very healing they seek
